title: Russia sees a further 10,000+ coronavirus cases; Spain's daily death toll stable
description: More than 251,000 people around the world have died from Covid-19 and over 3.5 million people have been infected, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

title: Stocks in Hong Kong rise as the city's economy takes a hit in first quarter
description: Hong Kong's government announced on Monday that the city's economy contracted 8.9% in the first quarter as compared to a year ago — its largest decline on record since 1974.

title: New York on 'other side of the mountain' as coronavirus deaths and hospitalizations fall, Cuomo says
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Monday that the state is now "on the other side of the mountain" as the daily number of hospitalizations, rate of new infections and deaths related to Covid-19 continue to decline.

title: FDA tightens rules on coronavirus antibody tests after accuracy concerns
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday tightened rules for antibody tests, ordering manufacturers to submit emergency use authorization forms and data proving the tests work within 10 days or face possible removal.

title: New Jersey schools will stay closed for the remainder of the academic year
description: New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy announced Monday that the state's schools will stay closed for the remainder of the academic year to continue to curb further spread of the coronavirus.

title: Watch: The World Health Organization holds a press briefing on the coronavirus pandemic
description: WHO is holding a briefing on the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: New York City to give away 7.5 million face coverings to prevent coronavirus spread, mayor says
description: "Wherever you turn, you're going to be offered a face covering, and it's going to be on an ongoing basis for weeks to come to make sure everyone has what they need," de Blasio said.

title: Projection estimates 135,000 US deaths by August; testing expanded for Fujifilm flu drug
description: Covid-19 has infected more than 3.5 million people around the world as of Monday, killing at least 247,752 people.
